• Jen confesses her lies about Cristian to her father. Marcie suggests Jen tell Cristian the truth herself to gain his sympathy.

• Al confides in Gabrielle about his sadness over Jessica's departure and reveals Max's desire to stay with Roxy.

• Gabrielle expresses loneliness despite her relationship with Bo.
</summary>

<summary>
• It's Chloe's christening and Jessica is happy to be starting a new beginning with her daughter.  However, it is revealed that Natalie and Jared switched Jessica's baby with Starr and Cole's deceased baby.
• The police are investigating the stabbings and find a knife with John McBain's fingerprint on it. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Todd is arrested for pushing Marty down the stairs, but he claims he is innocent and that the witness is lying. 
• Rex gets a lead on the necklace and is going to Santa Fe to follow up on it.
• Blair finds out that Téa is dying. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Viki collapses at the hospital after visiting Ben and is admitted. Her children and Dorian pray for her recovery.
• John believes he's ready to move on from Natalie and calls her to express his feelings. They agree to talk more in the morning.
• Marcie, determined to find evidence against Dr. Long, sneaks into his office while he's at the police station.
• Michael, worried about Marcie's safety, discovers she's gone to Dr. Long's office and fears for her well-being.
• David confronts Paul after overhearing Kelly wishing her brother dead. He accuses Paul of hurting Kelly and a physical altercation ensues.
• John, despite having Daniel's help, struggles to find solid evidence against Dr. Long for the illegal organ harvesting. 
</summary>

<summary>
• John and Blair suspect Miles is involved in Todd's disappearance after playing a recording of a crying baby found at Todd's last known location.  Miles acts nervous and claims he has a meeting. John follows him.
• Marty's car runs out of gas and she is attacked by three men, but fights them off with mace. Miles arrives shortly after, claiming to have been passing by, but John is suspicious of the coincidence.
• Jessica tells Antonio she is in love with Nash and ends their marriage. Antonio is devastated and angry with Cristian for knowing about the affair and not telling him.
• Viki and Clint discuss Jessica's illness and her breakup with Antonio. They search for alternative treatments and potential donors.  Viki speaks with Nigel, who offers support and to be tested as a donor.
• Jessica and Nash reaffirm their love for each other, but Jessica worries about her illness and the pain she caused Antonio. Nash is determined to find a donor and be with Jessica.
• Dorian comforts Clint about Jessica's illness and relationship issues. Blair learns about Jessica's illness from Dorian.
</summary>

<summary>
• Hunter moved Todd's body and demanded more money from Miles. 
• Miles paid Hunter but is now left to deal with Todd's body himself. 
• The police are looking for Hunter, and Sarah is worried she will be implicated. 
• Blair is angry with Sarah and doesn't believe her claims of innocence. 
• Dorian is jealous of Viki and David's relationship. 
• Clint is upset with Dorian for her jealousy and thinks she should have been more mature. 
• Marty is trying to protect John from Miles. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Natalie is still missing, and John and Marcie are working together to try and find her. Marcie is feeling guilty because the killer is using her old journals to find new ways to hurt people.
* Rex is feeling guilty because he feels like Natalie's kidnapping is his fault. He told Lindsay that he wrote the note from the killer that lured Natalie to the park.
* Jessica has gone missing, but she left a note for Antonio saying that she's okay and just needs some time. Todd is the only one who knows where she is, but he promised Jessica that he wouldn't tell anyone.
</summary>

<summary>
• John and Bo try to get information from Nick about Marcie and Natalie's whereabouts, but Nick goes into cardiac arrest.
• Rex and Marcie are tied up, slowly being hanged by a contraption set up by Hayes.
• Dorian wants Viki to be her matron of honor and Spencer to be David's best man, much to David's dismay.
• Blair and Starr have a heart-to-heart about the aftermath of Margaret's kidnapping.
• Tess asks Nash about his past, but he refuses to tell her anything.
• Todd enlists Rich's help to get in touch with Jessica.
• Adriana is worried about Rex and tells Dorian and David about his kidnapping. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Al's health deteriorates, and he is told he needs a liver transplant. 
• Antonio and Keri fight for custody of their daughter in court, with Antonio ultimately being granted joint custody.
• Todd serenades Blair on the piano in an attempt to win her over.
• Asa pressures Cristian to dig up dirt on Dawes, even if it means fabricating a scandal. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Rex accidentally ends up in the women's steam room with Kelly and reveals he told his girlfriend Gigi that they aren't sleeping together.
• Gigi is furious with Rex and gets into a physical altercation with Adriana.
• Layla is forced to choose between her career in Paris and her relationship with Cristian.
• Eddie, Ford and James's abusive father, shows up unexpectedly and moves in with them.
• Cole breaks up with Starr before going to prison, urging her to move on with her life.
• John is angry with Natalie for having an amniocentesis without telling him.
• Inez vows to protect her sons from Eddie. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Rebecca, driven by her vendetta against Theresa, forces Ethan to deliver an eviction notice to the Lopez-Fitzgerald family, claiming the house they live in belongs to Crane Industries. 
• Theresa witnesses Rebecca abusing little Ethan through a hidden camera but Child Protective Services doesn't believe her claims.
• Miguel loses his job at the cannery, likely due to Rebecca's machinations, and worries about supporting Kay and their baby. Kay offers support and suggests Miguel care for Maria while she works.
• Whitney considers singing at Liz's rebuilt club, the Blue Note. Liz encourages her, hoping to create conflict between Whitney and Eve.
• T.C. researches Whitney's behavior and concludes that she is lashing out because she feels like a failure compared to Eve's seemingly perfect life.
• Eve worries that Whitney will be tempted back into the music business and its associated dangers.
• Luis struggles to find work after being suspended from the police force, adding to the Lopez-Fitzgerald family's financial strain.
• Ethan is torn between his loyalty to Theresa and his desire to protect his relationship with Gwen, as Rebecca uses Gwen's past miscarriage to manipulate him. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Sheridan is in the hospital after Luis rescued her and Antonio from a fire at the Crane estate. Antonio is thankful to Luis for saving Sheridan's life, while Sheridan worries about who started the fire. 
• Meanwhile, Tom Joyner, a former Crane Industries employee with a grudge against Julian, arrives in Harmony. He initially plans to kill Julian but ultimately decides to take the bribe money offered by Julian and Rebecca.
• Liz continues to try to get closer to T.C., while Eve remains dedicated to her work at the hospital. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode revolves around multiple conflicts: Whitney gave her baby up for adoption, causing tension between her parents and their respective partners who want to adopt the child.
* Meanwhile, Sheridan is convinced that Beth's son, Marty, is actually hers, leading to escalating arguments and suspicion. On the other side of the world, Ethan, Theresa, and Fox are trying to escape Alistair's island while Gwen becomes increasingly unstable.
</summary>

<summary>
* Kay goes into premature labor after an argument with Miguel, causing her to fear for the baby's safety and her relationship with Miguel.
* Tabitha's demonic baby is born, and Charity witnesses the event, causing her to fear for her safety and the safety of others.
* Julian takes the blame for the fire at Liz's club, but T.C. and Eve are suspicious of his motives. Meanwhile, Luis is convinced that Sheridan is in trouble and restarts the search for her. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Spike confronts Jessica's family, threatening to reveal secrets if she testifies against him for abuse. Jessica ultimately sides with Spike.
• Kay and Miguel are mysteriously transported to a romantic location, where Miguel professes his love and proposes. Kay is confused and unsure if it's a dream.
• Sheridan reaffirms her commitment to Chris despite a passionate encounter with Luis.  Chris remains insecure about their relationship.
• Fancy and Chris discuss their relationships and the complications caused by Luis and Sheridan's past. Fancy and Luis's undercover operation is causing issues.
• Theresa, Jared, Ethan, and Gwen are involved in a comical farce involving loud lovemaking sounds coming from an unknown source, eventually revealed to be J.T. and Rebecca on a ledge outside.
</summary>

<summary>
• Kay wants to break up with Fox to be with Miguel, but Fox reveals he is dying.
• Fox received the news of his illness while on the phone with his doctor, with Kay and Miguel overhearing.
• J.T. is auctioning off the truth about Gwen and Theresa's schemes to Ethan, with the highest bidder getting to decide his fate.
• Gwen wins the auction, using money from her grandmother's jewelry and her mother's divorce settlement.
• Fancy is trapped down a hole, and Luis believes Chris is responsible for her predicament.
• Rebecca is pretending to be Gwen in bed with Ethan while Gwen is away bribing J.T.
• Luis jumps down the hole after Fancy when the board she is standing on breaks. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Kevin, struggling with addiction, seeks help from Karen but refuses traditional treatment, wanting the ingredients of Joshua's drug instead. He claims the drug improves his life, but Karen recognizes his manipulative behavior.
* Ian, battling his vampire urges, needs increasing amounts of blood, raising Chris's suspicions. Ian admits he's trying to resist feeding on Lucy.
* Elizabeth seeks Lucy's help to find Alison, who has been kidnapped by Joshua. Despite losing her Slayer powers, Lucy decides to use her intuition and mystical tools.
* Jamal, now a vampire, is revealed to be working with Joshua. Rafe confronts him about Alison's whereabouts, leading to a fight.
* Joshua reveals his past friendship with Alison's father, Malcolm, and how their relationship fueled his desire for power and revenge. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Adam is in jail for Skye's murder, but he claims he is being framed.
* Sharon was with Skye in Hawaii and believes Adam is innocent.
* Victor refuses to help Sharon prove Adam's innocence.
* Daniel is in critical condition after being attacked and left for dead in the cold.
* Daisy, a dangerous escapee, is on the run and believed to be responsible for Daniel's attack.
* Daisy is pregnant and recently crossed the Canadian border.
* Cane recommended Blake for a job, but Blake is not holding up his end of the bargain.
* Cane is caught in the middle when Blake fails to deliver a report on time.
* Colin wants to see his grandchildren, but Lily is avoiding him.
* Colin is working with Blake and seems to have ulterior motives.
</summary>

<summary>
* Victor is frustrated because his daughters, Victoria and Abby, are suing him.
* Abby is unsure about the lawsuit but Victoria convinces her to go through with it.
* Jack travels to Hawaii and finds the burned-down shack where Skye was living. He also finds a bottle of her rare perfume.
* Jack tries to convince the police that Skye was in Hawaii but they are not receptive.
* Sharon meets with the new DA, Spencer Walsh, to tell him about Jack's findings but he doesn't believe her.
* Ronan reveals to Nina that he has a fatal illness and she offers to donate part of her liver to save him.
* Heather steals the wire recording from Chance's sting operation and listens to it with Paul.
* Paul notices that the gunshot that seemingly killed Chance sounds like it was not a live round.
* The judge freezes one-third of Newman Enterprises' assets after Vance argues that Victor is trying to devalue the company.
* Adam calls Sharon to see how her meeting with the DA went and is disheartened to learn that they are not any closer to proving his innocence. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Jamie accuses Fenmore of pushing him off the roof and wants to press charges, despite Lauren's attempts to get him to stop lying. 
• Chelsea considers Cane attractive but feels guilty because she is still married to Adam, leading her mother to encourage her to have a fling. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Nick informs Victor that he has arranged for Newman Enterprises to buy Jabot's debt and intends to foreclose, putting Jabot out of business.
• Victor is furious, as he had promised the Abbotts he wouldn't take over Jabot, and Nick's actions make him appear untrustworthy.
• Jack calls an emergency shareholder meeting, revealing Nick's plan and proposing that Chancellor Industries buy 51% of Jabot to save it.
• Dru and Malcolm await the results of Lily's paternity test, with Malcolm worried about the impact on both families.
• Phyllis learns about the paternity test and confronts Dru, who begs her to stay out of their family business.
• Mac and J.T. discuss their Valentine's Day date, with J.T. expressing concern over Kevin's interest in Mac.
• Victor meets with the bankers and offers to buy Jabot's debt himself to prevent Nick from foreclosing.
• Nick accuses Victor of orchestrating the situation to humiliate him, but Victor maintains he's protecting Jabot and his word.
• The Jabot shareholders vote on Jack's proposal, with the outcome uncertain.
</summary>

<summary>
• Gloria and Jeff celebrate their victory in obtaining the Abbott mansion, but their relationship is strained as Gloria's sons refuse to reconcile with her.
• Jack struggles to cope with the loss of his childhood home, finding solace in Sharon's support.
• Jill and Kay enlist Alistair, the John Abbott impersonator, to help them uncover Gloria's true motives for marrying Jeff.
• Victor embarks on a trip to Los Angeles with Sabrina, exploring the art world and hinting at a potential legacy project.
</summary>

<summary>
• Adam's body is identified, and the police begin investigating his death as a homicide. They search the Newman Ranch and question Victor, Nick, and Sharon.
• Phyllis discovers blood on Nick's jacket from the night of the ball and worries that he might be implicated in Adam's death. She and Sharon try to dispose of the jacket before the police can find it.
• Jack learns that a handkerchief of his was found in Adam's mouth, making him a person of interest in the investigation.
• Victor tells the police that he broke his watch while backslapping Adam and that the blood on it is Adam's.
• Patty is revealed to be pregnant with Jack's child and becomes possessive of him, worrying about his relationship with Diane and Kyle.
• Abby runs into Ryder at a bar and confides in him about her family troubles. Ryder sees an opportunity to use Abby to his advantage.
• Lauren is convinced that Sheila is behind her kidnapping and confronts her, but is shocked to find someone else instead.
• The episode ends with a cliffhanger, suggesting that there is video evidence that could reveal the truth about Adam's death. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Jack is on his way to Las Vegas to marry Genevieve, but Nikki follows him to try and stop the wedding, believing it's a mistake driven by business interests.  She reveals Victor's scheme with Chelsea to seduce Billy, further fueling her argument against the marriage.

• Chelsea confesses to Adam her involvement in Victor's plot against Billy, admitting she let her friends plant drugs and falsely accused him of rape.  She expresses remorse but finds solace in giving her baby to Billy and Victoria.  Adam reveals his own history of being used by Victor.

• Victoria and Abby celebrate the birth of Victoria's baby, but their joy is tainted by Adam's presence and Victoria's lingering fear of Chelsea changing her mind.  The custody hearing for Lucy is scheduled, causing tension between Phyllis, Daniel, and Daisy.

• Devon and Harmony enjoy the song Tucker produced, strengthening their newfound family bond.  Meanwhile, Phyllis receives a sentimental gift from her deceased father, leading to an emotional conversation with Avery and Michael about family and loss.
</summary>

<summary>
* Genevieve sold Beauty of Nature to Victor, but there are concerns about the source of her funds and Adam's authority to sell.
* Phyllis is struggling to cope with the loss of Lucy's custody and blames Avery for her role in the situation.
* Devon celebrates his successful music career with his loved ones, while Neil grapples with his feelings for Harmony.
* Daisy taunts Lauren at her store, leading to a confrontation where Lauren pulls a gun on her and gets arrested.
* Tucker agrees to help Genevieve by lying to the SEC about lending her the money to buy Beauty of Nature.
* Michael juggles his responsibilities, including dealing with the SEC investigation, Lauren's arrest, and the Abbott adoption.
* Avery feels guilty about the fallout from Daisy's release and tries to make amends with Phyllis and Michael.
</summary>

<summary>
• It's Nick and Phyllis's one year anniversary. They celebrate with Nick sending Phyllis on a treasure hunt. 
• Adam proposes the acquisition of Green Clean, a natural cleaning products company. Victoria opposes the acquisition but Victor sides with Adam.
• Lily has lost her baby but is trying to cope by keeping busy and pretending nothing is wrong.
• Jeffrey is staying at Jill's after leaving Gloria. Gloria is furious and thinks Jill is trying to take advantage of the situation.
• Jack and Sharon reminisce about the affair Nick and Phyllis had and how it affected them. They are happy now but still feel a little bothered by it.
</summary>

<summary>
• Genevieve is grateful to Cane for helping her with the SEC investigation, but their relationship is strained. 
• Jill is upset with Genevieve for her past actions and warns her that she will pay for her crimes.
• Ricky is trying to get sympathy from Paul by pretending that his mother sent him a hateful birthday card.
• Paul asks Avery for her honest opinion of Ricky, and she tells him that he is amoral.
• Lauren is facing charges for assaulting Daisy, but Avery is able to get the charges dropped.
• Daisy asks Lauren for help registering for her wedding at Fenmore's.
• Phyllis tells Daniel that she is pregnant and that she and Nick are getting married.
• Daniel tells Phyllis that he and Daisy are getting married.
• Ricky tells Eden that he is going to bring Phyllis down.
</summary>

<summary>
* Cassie's memory is returning, and she remembers that she was driving the car during the accident.
* Michael surprises Lauren with a designer dress after ignoring her for days following his meeting with Tom. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Nick and Sharon are struggling with the anniversary of Cassie's death. Sharon is also having trouble with her medication and her feelings for Adam.
• Summer throws a party at the penthouse with alcohol, and Fenmore gets into a fight with Kyle after kissing Summer. Nick is furious with Summer for lying and drinking, and he takes away her car keys.
• Kyle admits to Jack that he is interested in Summer, but Jack warns him that Nick will not approve.
• Michael is angry with Lauren for her affair with Carmine and leaves her. Fenmore witnesses their fight and worries that they are getting a divorced.
• Paul confronts Carmine about his obsession with Lauren and warns him to stay away from her.
• Nick orders a paternity test.
</summary>

<summary>
• Chloe is missing after skipping her therapy appointment, which is a violation of her probation. Kevin is trying to find her before the police do.
• Kevin believes Chloe is at the movie theater where they had their last date before Delia's death. He finds her there and tries to convince her to get help.
• Chloe admits to Kevin that she drugged Billy to get pregnant and that she's not getting better. She agrees to get help.
• Ian's extortion charges have been dropped, and he's free to stay in Genoa City. He taunts Nikki, Dylan, and Victor with his newfound freedom.
• Victor confronts Ian and threatens him. Later, Ian is found beaten up.
• Avery is preparing for her appearance on "The Talk" but is distracted by Dylan and her concerns about Summer.
• Summer bonds with Austin over their shared experience of losing a parent. Avery warns Austin not to lead Summer on, but he reveals that he and his girlfriend have broken up.
</summary>

<summary>
• Nick is haunted by the death of his daughter, Cassie, and blames himself for letting her go out the night of the accident. He believes that if he had made different choices, everyone's lives would be better.
• Through a dream-like experience, Cassie guides Nick to see that his guilt and grief have led him to make more mistakes, damaging his relationships with Sharon, Daniel, and others. 
• Cassie helps Nick realize that he cannot change the past but can strive for a better future. Nick decides to move back home with Sharon and Noah, hoping to rebuild his family. 
</summary>

<summary>
• It's the day of the Newman Enterprises IPO and anticipation is in the air. Victor's lawyer, Michael, is confident that the stock will soar.
• Meanwhile, a custody hearing for baby Lucy is underway. Daisy, Lucy's biological mother, is fighting to regain custody with Phyllis's support, much to the dismay of Billy, Victoria, and Daniel.
• Phyllis's motives are questioned as it's revealed she made a deal with Daisy, promising to help her in exchange for custody of Lucy.
• At the Gloworm, Jack receives insider information from Diane about Adam's plan to sabotage Victor's IPO. He's about to make a fortune by shorting Newman Enterprises stock.
• Victor is visited by Diane, who drops a bombshell: she's pregnant and claims he's the father. Although skeptical, Victor agrees to support her until the paternity is confirmed.
• As the Newman Enterprises stock skyrockets, news breaks that Victor has suffered a stroke. 
• At the hospital, Diane experiences complications with her pregnancy and fears for her baby's life. Victor assures her that everything will be alright.
• The episode ends with the news of Victor's death, sending shockwaves through Genoa City. Jack seizes the opportunity to buy Newman Enterprises stock, anticipating a massive profit. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Adam is suing Nick for full custody of Christian after Victoria gave him a large sum of money to leave town. Adam also offered to give Dark Horse back to Nick in exchange for becoming CEO of Newman, but Victoria refused.
* Kevin kidnapped Phyllis to trade for Chloe, who is being held captive by Adam. Adam agreed to the trade, but Phyllis escaped before Kevin could follow through. Now, Adam is making Kevin stay in town to help him with something. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Kevin is moving to Portland with Bella for a fresh start after Chloe's death.
• Michael is concerned about Kevin's impulsive decision and urges him to stay in Genoa City.
• Chelsea offers Sharon her old job back at Chelsea 2.0, but Sharon declines due to her busy schedule.
• Nikki returns from a spa trip, claiming she needed to de-stress before her concert.
• Nick is worried about Nikki's health after learning from Tessa about her MS flare-up.
• Nikki insists she's fine and determined to perform, seeing the concert as a fresh start for herself.
• Kevin says a tearful goodbye to Michael and leaves for Portland with Bella, encountering Chelsea on their way out.
</summary>

<summary>
* JT is in Cleveland investigating Brad's past and believes he may have been involved in the murder of the Kaplan family.
* Kevin is being blackmailed by Alex over his involvement in drugging and robbing Lily. He gets $10,000 from Gloria to pay him off, but Alex says he made a copy of the tape.
* Nick tells Phyllis he loves her and the baby, but chooses to stay with Sharon and Noah. Phyllis says she will raise the baby on her own. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Phyllis is fired by Billy from Restless Style due to her arrest and the negative attention it brings, despite her attempts to leverage her value and offer to control the narrative. 
* Billy plans to exploit Phyllis's arrest for the magazine and his new TV series, much to Nick and Avery's dismay, who fear the negative impact on Phyllis's case.
* Jack manipulates Jabot's board members to retain his position, causing further conflict with Ashley, who wants to oust him.
* Victoria is torn between job offers from Jabot, Beauty of Nature, and Newman Enterprises, while also considering being a stay-at-home mom.
* Adam and Chelsea return from their elopement to a luxurious new home, while Anita's return threatens their happiness and stirs up trouble for Jeff and Gloria. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Hilary and Devon are getting married in the hospital because Hilary is seriously ill after a car accident. 
• Hilary knows her prognosis is bad but is trying to stay positive and enjoy her wedding day.
• Devon is trying to make the day special for Hilary, knowing it might be their last.
• Lily, who accidentally caused the car accident, is struggling with guilt but ultimately decides to attend the wedding to support Devon and Hilary.
• Mariah, Hilary's co-host, is planning to leave town with Tessa to help Tessa find her sister.
• Mariah is having a hard time leaving her life in Genoa City but is determined to be with Tessa.
• During the wedding ceremony, Hilary becomes weak and passes out but rallies to exchange vows with Devon.
• The episode ends with Hilary and Devon officially married.
</summary>

<summary>
* John Abbott is rushed to the hospital after suffering a mild stroke. While his family worries, his doctor remains optimistic that he will make a full recovery. John's condition seems to improve, but he suddenly has trouble breathing and the episode ends with John coding.
* Lily is struggling to cope with the revelation that Daniel knew about Alex's plan and didn't tell her. She moves out of Daniel's apartment and back in with her parents, but their constant arguing drives her out of the house.
* Dru and Neil's marriage continues to deteriorate as they argue about Lily's annulment and their own past mistakes. The tension comes to a head when Neil tells Dru that he can't stand to be around her anymore. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Jack angered Nick by making a callous comment about Victor.
• Adam fired Neil and Victoria from Newman Enterprises.
• Adam appointed Brad as the new CEO of Newman Enterprises.
• Brad's tell-all article put Jill and Jabot in jeopardy.
• Nikki is in denial about Victor's death and refuses to return home.
• Paul is on his way to Mexico to bring Nikki back.
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode centers around the anniversary of Katherine Chancellor's death, a beloved character.
* Katherine left letters for her friends and family, asking them to write down their feelings and burn the letters as a way to communicate with her.
* Neil is struggling with his recent blindness caused by an electrical accident.
* Devon and Hilary are drawn to each other despite Hilary being married to Neil.
* Victoria and Billy attend Johnny's preschool orientation, bringing back memories of Delia.
* Nikki is secretly drinking again and struggling with her emotions.
* Colin has gotten involved in a money-laundering scheme to protect Jill and his family.
* Jill finally realizes that the journey of finding Katherine's treasure brought her back to Colin, and she's happier than ever.
* Victor is secretly working with a doctor to try and bring Phyllis out of her coma.
* The episode ends with Jill returning Katherine's music box, content with her life and love for Colin. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Daniel's art show is a success, but he's upset that Billy bought all the sketches of Amber. Colleen comforts Daniel and they end up sleeping together.
* River is arrested and Michael agrees to look after his daughter, Eden.  Meanwhile, Jill celebrates the S.E.C. dropping their investigation and Kay experiences memory problems. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Jack resigns from the Abbott-Winters foundation and blames Billy for his lack of faith in second chances, revealing to everyone that Billy slept with Phyllis.
• Phyllis asks Jack for forgiveness, but he claims their marriage is over and kicks her out of the house, leading to a physical altercation where Phyllis falls and hits her head.
•  Nikki encourages both Phyllis and Ashley to try to reconcile with Jack, but Ashley believes Phyllis doesn't deserve Jack and hopes he never takes her back.
•  Victoria asks Travis to move in after he suggests giving her space to work through her feelings about Billy and Phyllis' affair. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Damon is in critical condition in the hospital after being attacked.
• Phyllis and Daniel are devastated and fear he won't survive.
• Damon is visited by the spirit of his deceased son, Elias.
• Elias encourages Damon to let go of his anger and guilt over his death.
• Damon eventually pulls through and is expected to recover.
• Ashley confesses her feelings to Victor, but he rejects her and reaffirms his love for Nikki.
• Ashley and Brad decide to separate, but vow to make the process amicable for Abby's sake.
• Lily confides in Kevin about her trauma from Alex, and he promises to protect her.
</summary>

<summary>
• Chance receives a commendation from the new D.A., Owen Pomerantz, for stopping a robbery.
• Daniel, Phyllis, and Amber worry about Daniel's upcoming grand jury hearing for murder and the possibility of him going back to jail.
• Michael argues with Heather about her handling of Daniel's case and the possibility of her facing consequences for prosecutorial misconduct.
• Billy and Mac break up after Mac finds out that Billy slept with Kelly.
• Chloe attends Chance's award ceremony and later runs into Billy, who is distraught over his break-up with Mac.
</summary>

<summary>
• Victoria experiences morning sickness, leading Billy to suspect she might be pregnant.

• Kevin and Chloe take Delia to a Christmas tree lot for a festive photoshoot, which turns chaotic and comical.  Jana reports them to Child Protective Services.

• Lily and Cane discuss Christmas plans with Jill, who is excited about her grandchildren's first Christmas.  They encounter Blake, Cane's colleague from Australia.

• Cane learns that Tucker is conducting a background check on Blake, who has fabricated his identity and references.

• Phyllis takes care of a pregnant Daisy while working on a controversial article about Adam and Sharon, which Billy worries will cause backlash.

• Daniel expresses his disapproval of Daisy's presence in his mother's house and suggests she come live with him, but Phyllis insists Daisy needs to stay with her due to a high-risk pregnancy.

• Kevin offers to raise Daisy's baby, causing conflict with Phyllis, who disapproves.

• Chloe and Kevin give Delia's Christmas gift to Kevin, and a social worker arrives at their door due to a complaint.
</summary>

<summary>
• It's Christmas Eve and everyone is preparing for the holiday.
• Devon and Hilary argue about Hilary's career ambitions, with Devon ultimately giving Hilary complete control of their show.
• Jack and Billy continue to be at odds, with Jack kicking Billy out of the Abbott family home.
• Phyllis accepts a job offer from Lauren to work at Fenmore's full-time.
</summary>

<summary>
• Faith runs away from Sharon's house after overhearing Nick and Sharon arguing about their break up. She is later found safe at the coffeehouse by Dylan.
• Victoria asks Billy to come to her office to discuss the christening for their daughter. She tells him that she wants to name her Katherine Rose Newman. Billy is upset that she doesn't want to give their daughter his last name. They argue and eventually agree on Katherine Rose Abbott-Newman.
• Ashley and Stitch try to act normal at work after their one-night stand. Abby picks up on the weird vibe between them.
• Victor meets with Tobias at the Underground to see what information he has on Ashley's work at Jabot. Tobias gives him Dr. Russell's files.
• Joe, Cane, and Colin discuss Joe's warehouse-development project. Jill shows up and makes it clear that she is not happy with any of them for supporting the project.
• Adam visits Constance and learns that his father committed suicide after losing his company to Victor Newman. Constance makes Adam promise to make Victor pay.
• Avery learns that her application to have the warehouse district designated as a historical landmark has been denied. She and Dylan suspect that someone with a lot of power is behind it.
</summary>

<summary>
• Jack is buying Chancellor Industries and giving Cane a position on the board as part of the deal.
• Jill is having second thoughts about the sale after learning about the Jabot drama.
• Lily is struggling with Cane's new family, especially Hilary's involvement.
• Mattie called the police on Reed after he drove drunk, worried he might hurt himself or someone else.
• Ashley called a board meeting and got a new amendment passed that requires the CEO to work from the Jabot office.
• Jack is determined to go through with buying Chancellor, even though Jill is having second thoughts and Ashley is fighting him. 
</summary>
